alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 3:59AM CDT until April 22 at 9:07AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam affecting Adams and Juneau Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:10 AM CDT Monday the flow was 35,434.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 3:10 AM CDT Monday was 35,481.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday afternoon and continue falling to 21,000.0 cfs Sunday evening. - Flood flow is 30,000.0 cfs. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM CDT.
